text.text_translated: Many questions remain about how genetics affects language. Researchers wonder if a special change in a gene, called a mutation, gave humans the ability to speak. They have found a mutation that happened between 200,000 and 100,000 years ago. This mutation seems to be related to speech and to the way our brains control the mouth and face. Monkeys have a similar DNA part, but they do not have this mutation. It is too early to say how much DNA influences language, but one day the answers may be found in our DNA.
